jokes.question: Why don't scientists trust atoms?
jokes.answer: Because they make up everything.

jokes.question: Did you hear about the mathematician who's afraid of negative numbers?
jokes.answer: He'll stop at nothing to avoid them.

jokes.question: Why did the scarecrow win an award?
jokes.answer: Because he was outstanding in his field.

jokes.question: I told my wife she was drawing her eyebrows too high.
jokes.answer: She looked surprised.

jokes.question: Parallel lines have so much in common.
jokes.answer: It's a shame they'll never meet.

jokes.question: Why couldn't the bicycle stand up by itself?
jokes.answer: Because it was two-tired.

jokes.question: How do you organize a space party?
jokes.answer: You 'planet'!

jokes.question: Why did the tomato turn red?
jokes.answer: Because it saw the salad dressing.

jokes.question: Why did the scarecrow become a successful politician?
jokes.answer: Because he was outstanding in his field and great at 'straw' polls.

jokes.question: What do you call a fake noodle?
jokes.answer: An 'impasta'!

jokes.question: Why did the math book look sad?
jokes.answer: Because it had too many problems.

jokes.question: How do you make holy water?
jokes.answer: You boil the hell out of it.

jokes.question: What's orange and sounds like a parrot?
jokes.answer: A carrot.

jokes.question: I'm reading a book on anti-gravity.
jokes.answer: It's impossible to put down.

jokes.question: Why did the scarecrow win an award?
jokes.answer: Because he was outstanding in his field.

jokes.question: Why don't skeletons fight each other?
jokes.answer: Because they don't have the guts.

jokes.question: What did the janitor say when he jumped out of the closet?
jokes.answer: Supplies!

jokes.question: Why did the golfer bring two pairs of pants?
jokes.answer: In case he got a hole in one.

jokes.question: Why don't oysters donate to charity?
jokes.answer: Because they are shellfish.

jokes.question: I used to play piano by ear, but now I use my hands.
jokes.answer: It's much easier that way.
